intro: Pentameris rosea subsp. rosea, commonly known as the pink sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its delicate pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal dunes and maritime hammocks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in coastal ecosystems.
